description.en: A protest song about displacement and cultural memory
description.nl: Een protestlied over ontheemding en cultureel geheugen

emotionalLineage.context: Created in response to forced displacement of communities, carrying intergenerational trauma and resistance narratives

conditions: No synthetic derivatives without explicit written consent
All uses must preserve emotional and cultural context

attribution.content: This remix honours Amara Okafor's 'Voices of the Displaced', preserving the themes of resistance and hope while extending the narrative to connect with other displacement stories worldwide. The broken chain and returning bird symbols are maintained and complemented with new cultural elements.

transformations.description: Added instrumentation from traditional Chinese erhu to connect with displacement narratives from the Chinese diaspora
Extended the narrative to include voices from multiple displaced communities

reciprocity.details: 5% of all proceeds shared with original creator, credited in all performances and recordings

description: AI Corp used my work for training their language model without consent, in violation of Clause 6.2. The work's emotional lineage and cultural context were stripped, and no attribution was provided.

evidence.content: Email correspondence with AI Corp acknowledging use without consent

description.en: A mythological narrative exploring intergenerational trauma through Celtic symbolism
description.nl: Een mythologisch verhaal dat intergenerationeel trauma verkent door middel van Keltische symboliek

emotionalLineage.context: Rooted in Scottish Highland clearances and the trauma of forced migration, woven with ancient Celtic mythology to preserve cultural memory

symbolicElements.meaning: Continuity of cultural memory despite displacement

conditions: AI-generated derivatives must preserve symbolic depth
All derivatives must include comprehensive lineage statements
Commercial AI use requires separate written agreement

attribution.content: This work builds upon Saoirse MacLeod's 'The Thread of Memory', using AI assistance to explore additional mythological connections while preserving the core themes of intergenerational trauma and cultural continuity. Original symbolism is maintained and expanded.

transformations.description: Used AI to identify connections with other Celtic mythological traditions
Added scholarly commentary on trauma transmission through narrative

reciprocity.details: Original work cited in academic publication, full attribution provided, no commercial use

description: A commercial entity used 'The Thread of Memory' in a marketing campaign for tourism, stripping all cultural context and reducing the intergenerational trauma narrative to a shallow 'mysterious Scotland' aesthetic. This violates Clause 2.2 prohibitions on trivialisation.

evidence.content: Screenshot of marketing materials showing appropriation

resolution.outcome: Tourism corporation agreed to remove materials, issue public apology, and compensate original creator
resolution.remediation: Materials removed, donation made to Scottish cultural heritage fund, company implemented cultural sensitivity training
